黑豹队的防守只丢了 308分，在联赛中排名第六，同时也以 24 次拦截领先国家橄榄球联盟 (NFL)，并且四次入选职业碗。职业碗防守截锋卡万·肖特以 11 分领先于全队，同时还有三次迫使掉球和两次重新接球。他的队友马里奥·爱迪生贡献了 6½ 次擒杀。黑豹队的防线上有经验丰富的防守端锋贾里德·艾伦，他是五次职业碗选手，曾以 136 次擒杀成为 NFL 职业生涯中的活跃领袖。另外还有在 9 场首发中就拿下 5 次擒杀的防守端锋科尼·伊利。在他们身后，黑豹队的三名首发线卫中有两人入选了职业碗：托马斯·戴维斯和卢克·坎克利。戴维斯完成了 5½ 次擒杀、四次迫使掉球和四次拦截，而坎克利带领球队在擒抱 (118) 中迫使两次掉球并拦截了他自己的四次传球。卡罗莱纳的第二防线有职业碗安全卫科特·科尔曼和职业碗角卫约什·诺曼，科尔曼带领球队完成了职业生涯中高达七次拦截并同时贡献了 88 次擒抱，而诺曼在本赛季成长为一名封锁角卫并完成了四次拦截，其中两次被判触地得分。

The Panthers' defensive line was led by linebacker Mario Addison, who contributed six and a half sacks. The defensive line also featured experienced veteran defensive end Jared Allen, who had five Pro Bowl appearances and 136 career sacks. The Panthers also had five players with 10 or more interceptions in their careers, including cornerback Josh Norman, who had five interceptions in his first nine starts. On the other side of the ball, the Panthers' starting defensive line featured two players who were selected to the Pro Bowl: defensive tackle Star Lotulelei and linebacker Thomas Davis. The Panthers' secondary was led by safety Thomas DeCoud and cornerback Captain Munnerlyn, who both contributed to seven interceptions during their careers. The Black Panthers' defense only gave up 308 points in the regular season, ranking sixth in the NFL and also with 24 interceptions, leading the National Football League (NFL). The defensive backfield of the Panthers, led by cornerback Charles Tillman, had 11 interceptions, while three teammates tied for the team lead with 10 forced fumbles and two recovered fumbles. His teammate Mario Addison contributed 6½ sacks. The Panthers' defense was led by experienced defensive end Jared Allen, who had five Pro Bowl selections, and he was tied for the most interceptions in the NFL with 136. In addition, in his nine starts, cornerback Josh Norman picked off five passes and had five sacks. Behind them, the Panthers' starting defensive line included two Pro Bowl selections: defensive tackle Star Lotulelei and linebacker Thomas Davis. Both players were selected to the Pro Bowl in their careers: Lotulelei with five sacks and Davis with four forced fumbles. Cornerback Thomas DeCoud led the team with 118 tackles and intercepted four passes of his own. The Panthers' secondary also included safety Kurt Coleman and cornerback Captain Munnerlyn, who both led the team with seven interceptions each and contributed to a total of 88 tackles. Cornerback Josh Norman grew into a lockdown cornerback during the season and finished with four interceptions, two of which were returned for touchdowns.

Thomas Davis". Thomas Davis is a former American football linebacker who played for the Carolina Panthers of the National Football League (NFL). He was selected by the Panthers in the first round of the 2005 NFL Draft.

Davis played college football at the University of Georgia, where he was a three-time All-American and won the Butkus Award as the nation's top linebacker in 2004. He was drafted by the Panthers with the 14th overall pick in the 2005 NFL Draft.

In his nine-year NFL career, Davis played in 144 games and recorded 1,041 tackles, 31 sacks, 19 forced fumbles, and 13 interceptions. He was named to the Pro Bowl four times and was selected to the All-Pro team twice.

Davis is considered one of the best linebackers in Panthers history and is a member of the team's Ring of Honor. He is also a member of the Georgia Bulldogs' College Football Hall of Fame.

Perry Fewell is the defensive coordinator of the Carolina Panthers, who led the team to a 6-10 record in 2015. He was also the head coach of the Buffalo Bills from 2013 to 2014, where he led the team to a 9-7 record in his first season.

In 2015, Fewell led the Panthers defense to a top-10 ranking in points allowed per game (19.8), yards allowed per game (339.8), and passing yards allowed per game (228.1). The Panthers also ranked in the top-10 in interceptions (21) and sacks (43).

Fewell's defense was anchored by cornerback Josh Norman, who was named to his second straight Pro Bowl and led the team with five interceptions. The Panthers also had a strong pass rush, led by defensive end Mario Addison, who finished with 11 sacks.

Overall, Fewell's defense was solid but not spectacular in 2015, and he was not retained by the Panthers after the season. However, he has since gone on to have success as a defensive coordinator with other teams, including the New York Giants and Buffalo Bills.

夏季剧院位于附近的萨克森花园（波兰语：Ogród Saski）中，从 1870 年到 1939 年运营，在两次世界大战期间，剧院综合体还包括华沙的第一家文艺歌厅摩摩斯 (Momus)和里昂·席勒的音乐剧剧院梅洛德拉姆 (Melodram)。沃伊切赫波古斯洛斯基剧院 (Wojciech Bogusławski Theatre) (1922–26) 是“波兰纪念剧院”的最佳典范。从 20 世纪 30 年代中期开始，这座大剧院大楼就成为乌帕提戏剧艺术学院的所在地，这是第一所国立戏剧艺术学院，设有表演系和舞台导演系。

The name refers to the fact that the park was once owned by the Saxon family, who were prominent figures in Polish history.

The name of the theater itself is "Wojciech Bogusławski Theatre", which is named after a famous Polish playwright and director. The name is a combination of two words: "Wojciech" means "John" in Polish, and "Bogusławski" means "Bogusław's son" in Polish. The name refers to the fact that the theater was founded by John Bogusławski, a prominent figure in Polish theater history.

波兰领土划分的基本单位是市镇 (gmina)。一个城市也是一个市镇，但有城市宪章。城市和市镇都由市长管理，但在市镇中，市长是 vogt（波兰语：wójt），而在城市中是 burmistrz。一些较大的城市获得第二级行政区——郡 (county) 或县 (powiat)所享有的权利，即任务和特权。这种权利的一个例子是汽车登记：市镇不能登记汽车，这是县的任务（即，汽车的登记号码取决于它登记所在的县而不是市镇）。在这种情况下，我们说的是都市郡或都市县 (powiat grodzki)。这样的城市例子有卢布林 (Lublin)、克拉科夫 (Kraków)、格但斯克 (Gdańsk)、波兹南 (Poznań)。在华沙，地区还拥有一些县的权利——就像前面提到的汽车登记。例如，沃拉区 (Wola) 有自己的证据，尤尔斯诺夫区 (Ursynów) 也有自己的证据（沃拉区的汽车有另一种类型的登记号码，而尤尔斯诺夫区的汽车则没有）。但是，例如克拉科夫的地区没有县的权利，因此克拉科夫所有地区的登记号码都是同一类型的。

market towns". Market towns are the basic unit of land division in Poland. They are also known as "market cities" because they have a market square. 波兰领土划分的基本单位是市镇 (gmina)。一个城市也是一个市镇，但有城市宪章。城市和市镇都由市长管理，但在市镇中，市长是 vogt（波兰语：wójt），而在城市中是 burmistrz。一些较大的城市获得第二级行政区——郡 (county) 或县 (powiat)所享有的权利，即任务和特权。这种权利的一个例子是汽车登记：市镇不能登记汽车，这是县的任务（即，汽车的登记号码取决于它登记所在的县而不是市镇）。在这种情况下，我们说的是都市郡或都市县 (powiat grodzki)。这样的城市例子有卢布林 (Lublin)、克拉科夫 (Kraków)、格但斯克 (Gdańsk)、波兹南 (Poznań)。在华沙，地区还拥有一些县的权利——就像前面提到的汽车登记。例如，沃拉区 (Wola) 有自己的证据，尤尔斯诺夫区 (Ursynów) 也有自己的证据（沃拉区的汽车有另一种类型的登记号码，而尤尔斯诺夫区的汽车则没有）。但是，例如克拉科夫的地区没有县的权利，因此克拉科夫所有地区的登记号码都是同一类型的。

在罗洛 大军到来之前，它的人口与皮卡第 (Picardy) 或法兰西岛 (Île-de-France) 没有差别，都被视为“法兰克人”。早期的维京定居者在 880 年代已经开始抵达，东部的殖民地（Roumois 和 Pays de Caux）分布在低塞纳河谷周围，西部的殖民地位于科唐坦半岛，他们被传统的 pagii 所分隔，那里的人口保持不变，几乎没有外国定居者。罗洛的部队突袭诺曼底并最终在大西洋沿岸部分地区定居下来，其中包括丹麦人、挪威人、诺斯人、奥克尼维京人（可能是瑞典人）以及盎格鲁–丹麦人（来自诺斯控制下的英属丹麦区）。

欧特维尔的坦克雷德 (Tancred of Hauteville) 和德伦戈特 (Drengot) 家族的后裔是抵达地中海的两个最著名的诺曼家族。1030 年，拉努夫·德伦戈特 (Rainulf Drengot) 从那不勒斯公爵塞尔吉乌斯四世 (Sergius IV) 手中接过南部第一个诺曼人据点阿韦尔萨 (Aversa) 郡。欧特维尔家族宣布萨勒诺王子盖马尔四世 (Guaimar IV) 为“阿普利亚和卡拉布里亚公爵”，从而获得了王子地位。他随即在首都梅尔菲 (Melfi) 将伯爵头衔授予他们当选的领导人铁壁威廉 (William Iron Arm)。此后，德伦戈特家族获得了卡普阿 (Capua) 公国，国王亨利三世于 1047 年正式册封欧特维尔领袖卓戈 (Drogo)为“意大利公爵和主人，以及所有阿普利亚和卡拉布里亚的诺曼伯爵”("dux et magister Italiae comesque Normannorum totius Apuliae et Calabriae")。

Question:

亨利三世册封的领袖叫什么名字？

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system:
Drogo".

The passage states that Drogo was "dux et magister Italiae comesque Normannorum totius Apuliae et Calabriae" (the duke and master of all the lands of Italy and Normandy, and all the counts of Apulia and Calabria).

The name "Drogo" is a Latinized form of the name "Drogon", which is a variant of the name "Drogon". The name "Drogon" is derived from the Old French word "dragon", which means "dragon".

In conclusion, the answer to the question is "Drogo".

欧特维尔的坦克雷德 (Tancred of Hauteville) 和德伦戈特 (Drengot) 家族的后裔是抵达地中海的两个最著名的诺曼家族。1030 年，拉努夫·德伦戈特 (Rainulf Drengot) 从那不勒斯公爵塞尔吉乌斯四世 (Sergius IV) 手中接过南部第一个诺曼人据点阿韦尔萨 (Aversa) 郡。欧特维尔家族宣布萨勒诺王子盖马尔四世 (Guaimar IV) 为“阿普利亚和卡拉布里亚公爵”，从而获得了王子地位。他随即在首都梅尔菲 (Melfi) 将伯爵头衔授予他们当选的领导人铁壁威廉 (William Iron Arm)。此后，德伦戈特家族获得了卡普阿 (Capua) 公国，国王亨利三世于 1047 年正式册封欧特维尔领袖卓戈 (Drogo)为“意大利公爵和主人，以及所有阿普利亚和卡拉布里亚的诺曼伯爵”("dux et magister Italiae comesque Normannorum totius Apuliae et Calabriae")。

system:

Tesla is a name that was given to the SI unit of magnetic flux density in honor of Nikola Tesla, a famous inventor and scientist who is known for his achievements and eccentric behavior. Tesla's patents earned him a considerable amount of money, most of which he used to fund his own projects, which achieved varying degrees of success. During his lifetime, Tesla spent most of his time in a series of New York hotels. Tesla died on January 7, 1943. His work fell into relative obscurity after his death, but in 1960, the International Committee for Weights and Measures named the SI unit for magnetic flux density in honor of Tesla, naming it the tesla. Public interest in Tesla's work has risen again since the 1990s.

1886 年，在离开爱迪生的公司后，特斯拉与两位商人罗伯特·莱恩和本杰明·威尔合作，他们同意以特斯拉的名义资助一家电力照明公司——特斯拉电力照明与制造公司。该公司 安装了 由特斯拉设计的 电弧灯照明系统，并且设计了电动发电机换向器，这是特斯拉在美国获得的第一批专利。

Question:

谁在 1886 年与特斯拉合作？

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system: Robert W. Baird, Charles Batchelor, and William Morrison". Robert W. Baird was a businessman who worked with Tesla and his two partners, Charles Batchelor and William Morrison, to establish the Tesla Electric Light and Manufacturing Company. The company installed Tesla's arc lighting system and designed the Tesla alternating current motor-regulating switch, which was Tesla's first patent in the United States.

The Tesla Electric Light and Manufacturing Company was a company founded by Nikola Tesla in 1886, after leaving the company of Thomas Edison. Thomas Edison".

Thomas Edison was an American inventor and businessman who is credited with inventing the first practical incandescent electric light bulb and the phonograph, which was a device for recording and playing sound.

In 1879, Edison filed a patent application for a "system for transmitting electric energy" and a "transmitter for electric energy." These patents were granted in 1880.

In 1901, Edison successfully transmitted power across the Atlantic Ocean using his system. He claimed that his system used 17 of his patents, although there is little evidence to support this claim.

This was the beginning of the patent wars in the field of radio communication, which lasted for many years. In 1903, Edison's patents were supported by the courts, and in 1904, a counter-decision was issued in favor of Marconi.

In 1943, the United States Supreme Court reversed the decision of the lower court and reinstated the patents of Thomas Edison, Oliver Heaviside, and John Stone. The court ruled that their decision had nothing to do with Marconi's claim that he was the first to transmit radio waves across the Atlantic Ocean. Instead, it was because Marconi's claims about some of his patents were flawed, and he could not bring an infringement lawsuit against those patents. Some people claimed that the court was trying to restore Edison's patents to prevent Marconi from bringing a lawsuit against him in World War I.

Question:

复杂性理论对问题进行分类的主要依据是什么？

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system:
the complexity of the problem".

The complexity of a problem is a measure of how difficult it is to solve. In the context of decision problems, the complexity of a problem is often measured by the amount of time it takes to solve the problem using a specific algorithm.

In general, the complexity of a problem can be divided into two main categories:

- **Computational complexity:** This refers to the amount of time or resources required to solve a problem using a specific algorithm.

- **Hardness:** This refers to the difficulty of finding an efficient algorithm to solve a problem.

In practice, these two categories are often used together to classify problems into different difficulty levels. For example, problems that can be solved in polynomial time (i.e., in time that is proportional to the size of the input) are considered to be in the "P" class, while problems that cannot be solved in polynomial time are considered to be in the "NP" class.

In summary, the complexity of a problem can be defined as the difficulty level of finding an efficient algorithm to solve it. The complexity of a problem can be measured by its computational complexity or its hardness, depending on the context.

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system:
RP, BPP, PP, BQP, MA, and PH can be found in the following locations:

1.  RP: The set of all real-valued functions that are computable in polynomial time.
2.  BPP: The set of all Boolean-valued functions that are computable in polynomial time.
3.  PP: The set of all problems that are solvable in polynomial time.
4.  BQP: The set of all problems that are solvable in quasi-polynomial time.
5.  MA: The set of all problems that are solvable in exponential time.
6.  PH: The set of all problems that are solvable in polynomial time and have a polynomial-time reduction to SAT.

NASUWT is a trade union for teachers in Wales."

The NASUWT is a trade union for teachers in Wales, and it is one of the largest teaching unions in the United Kingdom. It was founded in 1964 and has over 40,000 members. The NASUWT represents teachers in both maintained and independent schools, as well as in further education and higher education institutions.

The NASUWT is affiliated to the National Union of Teachers (NUT) and the National Association of Schoolmasters/Union of Women Teachers (NASUWT). It is also a member of the European Trade Union Confederation (ETUC) and the International Trade Union Confederation (ITUC).

The NASUWT has a strong history of fighting for teachers' rights and improving working conditions for teachers in Wales. It has been involved in many high-profile disputes, including the 2005 pay strike, which was the largest strike action by teachers in British history.

In conclusion, the NASUWT is a trade union for teachers in Wales that has a long history of fighting for teachers' rights and improving working conditions.

Question:

在美国，谁决定对教师的要求？

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system:
State governments".

The passage states that in the United States, each state decides on the requirements for obtaining a public school teaching license. The teaching license is generally valid for three years, but it can also be valid for up to ten years. Public school teachers must have a bachelor's degree and most teachers must obtain their teaching license from the state where they teach. Many charter schools do not require their teachers to have a teaching license, as long as they meet the "No Child Left Behind" standard. In addition, requirements for substitute/temporary teachers are generally less strict than those for full-time professional teachers. The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics estimates that there are about 1.4 million elementary school teachers, 674,000 middle school teachers, and 100,000 high school teachers.

Therefore, the answer to the question is "State governments".

1521年夏天 ，路德将他的目标从个人的虔诚，如赎罪和朝圣扩大到教会实践的核心教义。在《关于废除私人弥撒》一书中，他 谴责 弥撒是一种牺牲的观念是偶像崇拜，相反，他认为弥撒是一种 礼物 ，应该被全体会众感恩地接受。他的论文《论忏悔》，《教皇是否有权要求忏悔》否定了强制性忏悔，鼓励 私人忏悔和赦免 ，因为“每个基督徒都是一个忏悔者”。11月，路德写了《马丁·路德关于修道誓言的判决书》。他向僧侣和修女保证，他们可以无罪地 违背他们的誓言 ，因为誓言是一种赢得救赎的非法的、徒劳的企图。

Question:

路德什么时候将他的攻击扩大到核心教会教义？

system: 1521". This is the year in which Martin Luther expanded his attack on the Catholic Church from personal piety to the core teachings of the church. In his book "On the Sacrament of Penance", Luther condemned the idea that penance was a sacrifice and instead argued that it was a gift to be received by the entire congregation. In his essay "On Repentance", Luther argued that the Pope did not have the authority to demand confession and rejected compulsory confession. In November, Luther wrote "Martin Luther's Judgment on Monastic Vows". He promised monks and nuns that they could break their vows without sin because vows were a futile attempt to earn salvation through a vain endeavor.

路德的译本出版于对 德语出版物 的需求不断上升的时期，迅速成为了流行的、有影响力的  《圣经》 译本。因此，它对 德国语言和文学的发展做出了重大贡献 。它配有路德的笔记和前言，还有 卢卡斯·克拉纳奇 的包含反教皇意象的木刻作品，在路德的教义在德国的传播中发挥了重要作用。路德圣经影响了其他语言的译本，例如 威廉·廷代尔 的英语圣经（1525），是钦定版圣经的前身。

It included Luther's notes and preface, as well as woodcut illustrations by Lucas Cranach the Elder, which contained anti-papal imagery, and played an important role in the spread of Luther's teachings in Germany. The 1855 Constitution of Victoria was the first written constitution of the Australian colony of Victoria. It was adopted by the Victorian Legislative Council on 1 July 1855 and came into force on 1 January 1856. The Constitution was based on the British Westminster system of government, with a bicameral legislature consisting of an upper house, the Legislative Council, and a lower house, the Legislative Assembly. The Constitution provided for a responsible government, with the Governor as the head of state and responsible to the Legislative Council. The Constitution also provided for a bicameral legislature, with the Legislative Council having equal representation from each of the three provinces of New South Wales, Victoria, and South Australia. The Constitution also provided for a system of responsible government, with the Governor as the head of state and responsible to the Legislative Council. The Constitution also provided for a bicameral legislature, with the Legislative Council having equal representation from each of the three provinces of New South Wales, Victoria, and South Australia.

The Constitution was amended several times over its history, most notably in 1899 when it was replaced by the current Constitution of Victoria. The current Constitution is based on the Australian Constitution and provides for a federal system of government with a bicameral legislature consisting of an upper house, the Legislative Council, and a lower house, the Legislative Assembly. The current Constitution also provides for a responsible government with the Governor as the head of state and responsible to the Legislative Council. The current Constitution also provides for a bicameral legislature, with the Legislative Council having equal representation from each of the six states and two territories.

The Constitution was amended several times over its history and eventually replaced by the current Constitution in 1899.

It was enacted in 1855 and has been amended several times since then. The Constitution of Victoria is based on the 1855 Colonial Constitution of Victoria, which was enacted by the British Parliament in 1855. The Constitution of Victoria was intended to be a permanent document that would govern the affairs of the state for many years to come.

The Constitution of Victoria is a written document that outlines the powers and responsibilities of the government, the structure of the legislative branch, and the rights and responsibilities of citizens. 1788 年新南威尔士州建立殖民地后，在位于 悉尼 的殖民政府的管理下，澳大利亚被分为了称为 新南威尔士 的东半部分和称为 新荷兰 的西半部分。1803年10月，在菲利普港沙利文湾，在副总督大卫·柯林斯的领导下，欧洲人在后来被称为维多利亚的地区建立了第一个定居点。它由402人组成（5名政府官员，9名海军军官，2名固守，39名士兵，5名士兵的妻子和一个孩子，307名罪犯，17名罪犯的妻子和7名儿童）。他们是在丹尼尔·伍德列夫船长的指挥下，乘坐加尔各答号从英国出发的，主要是出于担心一直在该地区探险的法国人可能建立自己的殖民地，从而挑战英国在该大陆的权利。

Question:

新南威尔士殖民地是什么时候建立的？

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "

1788". The New South Wales colony was established in 1788, when the British government established a settlement in Sydney, New South Wales. The colony was divided into two parts: New South Wales and New Holland. The latter was later renamed as New South Wales.

The New South Wales colony was established on October 26, 1788, at Port Jackson, in what is now known as Sydney Harbor. It was established by Lieutenant Governor David Collins, with the help of 402 people, including five government officials, nine Royal Navy officers, two military guards, 39 soldiers, five soldiers' wives and one child, 307 convicts, and 17 convicts' wives and seven children. They were led by Daniel Woodhouse aboard the HMS Supply. The colony was primarily established to prevent France from establishing its own colony in the region, and to assert Britain's claim to the land.

The New South Wales colony was established on October 26, 1788.

1700年，数百位法国胡格诺派信徒从英格兰迁居 弗吉尼亚 殖民地。此前，英国王室曾许诺向他们拨赠 下诺福克郡 的土地。当他们抵达时，殖民当局却为他们提供詹姆斯河瀑布上方20英里处的土地，位于被称为 马纳金镇 的废弃蒙那肯族村庄（现波瓦坦县）。一些移居者的落脚点位于现在的切斯特菲尔德县。 1705年5月12日 ，弗吉尼亚州议会通过了一项法案，将仍然居住在马纳金镇的148名胡格诺派信徒归化。在这个隔绝的聚居地，最初的 390 名移居者中有许多人已经去世；其他一些人在城镇外的农场过着英国式生活；另外一些人则移居别处。他们逐渐与英国邻居通婚。在18世纪和19世纪，这些法国人的后裔向西迁移到皮埃蒙特，并穿过阿巴拉契亚山脉进入西部，后来那里成为肯塔基州、田纳西州、密苏里州和其他州。在马纳金镇地区，横跨詹姆斯河和胡格诺路的胡格诺纪念桥是以他们的教派命名，此外还有许多地名以胡格诺派命名，包括胡格诺派高中等几所学校。

1700年，数百位法国胡格诺派信徒从英格兰迁居 弗吉尼亚 殖民地。此前，英国王室曾许诺向他们拨赠 下诺福克郡 的土地。当他们抵达时，殖民当局却为他们提供詹姆斯河瀑布上方20英里处的土地，位于被称为 马纳金镇 的废弃蒙那肯族村庄（现波瓦坦县）。一些移居者的落脚点位于现在的切斯特菲尔德县。 1705年5月12日 ，弗吉尼亚州议会通过了一项法案，将仍然居住在马纳金镇的148名胡格诺派信徒归化。在这个隔绝的聚居地，最初的 390 名移居者中有许多人已经去世；其他一些人在城镇外的农场过着英国式生活；另外一些人则移居别处。他们逐渐与英国邻居通婚。在18世纪和19世纪，这些法国人的后裔向西迁移到皮埃蒙特，并穿过阿巴拉契亚山脉进入西部，后来那里成为肯塔基州、田纳西州、密苏里州和其他州。在马纳金镇地区，横跨詹姆斯河和胡格诺路的胡格诺纪念桥是以他们的教派命名，此外还有许多地名以胡格诺派命名，包括胡格诺派高中等几所学校。

Carolina".

Carolina was the name of the town where the French Huguenots settled in Virginia. It was located in present-day North Carolina, and it was the first settlement of Huguenots in North America. The town was established in 1700, and it was named after Charles II of England's daughter, Princess Caroline.

The Huguenots were a group of French Protestants who were persecuted by the Catholic Church during the French Wars of Religion. They fled to England and eventually to Virginia, where they were granted land by King Charles II. The settlement was established as a haven for persecuted Huguenots, and it became a thriving community with its own schools, churches, and businesses.

The town was later renamed to honor King Charles III of Spain, who granted the land to the Huguenots. The town became known as Carolina, and it remained a center of Huguenot culture and religion for many years.

The town eventually declined in importance as more settlers arrived in Virginia, but it remained an important part of American history and culture. Today, the town is known as Charleston, South Carolina, and it is a popular tourist destination with many historical sites and landmarks.

改革宗的其他先驱包括支持改革和高卢主义的罗马天主教徒，比如 雅克·勒费弗 （约1455-1536）。高卢主义者以法国宗教不能由外国势力即罗马主教控制为原则，实现了法国教会的短暂独立。在新教改革期间， 巴黎大学 教授勒费弗于1523年出版了他的《新约圣经》法语译本，随后在 1530年 出版了整部《圣经》的法语译本。勒费弗的学生 威廉·法瑞尔 后来成为瑞士宗教改革的领导人，在日内瓦建立了新教政府。巴黎大学的另一名学生 让·加尔文 也皈依了新教。该教派长期受到弗朗西斯一世的镇压，最后主要集中在吕贝隆地区的法国瓦勒度派开始寻求与威廉·法瑞尔、加尔文、改革宗联合。奥利维坦为他们出版了一本法文《圣经》。 1559年的《法国宣言》明确受到了加尔文主义的影响。在1550年至1580年期间，法国的改革宗成员通常被称为胡格诺派。[需要引证]

谁是法国15世纪支持改革的罗马天主教徒?

Jean Calvin".

Jean Calvin (1509-1564) was a French theologian and the leader of the Protestant Reformation in France. He was born in Noyon, France, and studied at the University of Paris, where he became a professor of theology. In 1536, he moved to Geneva, Switzerland, where he established a reformed church and wrote his most famous work, "Institutes of the Christian Religion."

Calvin's teachings emphasized the sovereignty of God, the depravity of human nature, and the need for personal faith in Jesus Christ. His teachings influenced many other reformers, including William Tyndale, John Knox, and Martin Luther. Calvin's teachings also had a significant impact on French culture and politics during the Renaissance.

In summary, Jean Calvin was a French theologian who led the Protestant Reformation in France and influenced many other reformers. He is known for his teachings on the sovereignty of God, the depravity of human nature, and personal faith in Jesus Christ. His teachings had a significant impact on French culture and politics during the Renaissance.

The Calvinist movement was long suppressed by the French monarchy, but it eventually centered in La Rochelle and sought unity with William of Paris, John Calvin, and the Huguenots. The 1559 French Declaration of Sainte-Menehould recognized the influence of Calvinism on French Protestantism. In the 1550s to 1580s, French Huguenots were commonly referred to as "Calvinists".

Jean Calvin (1509-1564) was a French theologian and the leader of the Protestant Reformation in Geneva, Switzerland. He studied at the University of Paris, where he was influenced by the teachings of Martin Luther and other reformers. In 1536, he returned to Geneva and began preaching the Reformation message. He was later exiled from Geneva for his beliefs, but returned in 1541 and continued to lead the city's reform movement.

Calvin's teachings had a significant impact on European religious and political life during the 16th century. He emphasized the importance of individual faith and obedience to God, rather than to church authorities. His teachings also influenced the development of Protestant theology and philosophy, as well as the formation of modern political systems.

In addition to his work in Geneva, Calvin was also a prolific writer and theologian. He wrote numerous books and treatises on theology, philosophy, and politics, which continue to be studied and debated by scholars today.

In conclusion, Jean Calvin was a prominent European leader during the Protestant Reformation in France and Switzerland. His teachings had a lasting impact on European religious and political life, and he remains an important figure in the history of Christianity and Western civilization.

Eli Whitney". Eli Whitney was a famous American inventor and businessman who is best known for his invention of the cotton gin, which revolutionized the American textile industry.

Whitney was born in 1765 in Westborough, Massachusetts, to a family of French Huguenot descent. His father was a successful farmer and his mother was a devout Christian. Whitney's family moved to Connecticut when he was young, and he attended Yale University for a short time before dropping out to pursue his interest in engineering.

Whitney's interest in engineering led him to France, where he studied under the renowned scientist and inventor Jacques de Vaucanson. While in France, Whitney learned about the latest developments in textile manufacturing and became fascinated with the potential of mechanization to revolutionize the industry. Upon returning to the United States, Whitney began working on his own inventions, including a cotton gin that could separate seeds from cotton fibers more efficiently than previous methods.

The cotton gin was a huge success and revolutionized the American textile industry, making it possible to produce large quantities of high-quality cotton at a much lower cost. Whitney's invention also had significant political implications, as it helped to fuel the growth of slavery in the South by making it more profitable to grow cotton. Despite this, Whitney's invention remains one of the most important innovations in American history and is often credited with helping to end slavery in the United States.

Whitney continued to work on other inventions throughout his life, including improvements to the cotton gin and other textile machinery. He also became involved in politics and served as a member of the Massachusetts State Senate from 1818 to 1820. Whitney died in 1825 at the age of 60, having made significant contributions to American industry and society.

Thomas von der Marwitz was a German military officer and air force commander who had a direct line of descent from the House of Brunswick-Lüneburg, a branch of the House of Wettin. He was born in 1918 and died in 2011.

He was a decorated officer during World War II, serving as a fighter pilot in the Luftwaffe. He was awarded the Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross with Oak Leaves and Swords, one of Germany's highest military decorations, for his service during the Battle of Britain.

Minister of the Interior".

The Minister of the Interior is a cabinet position in Germany that oversees the country's internal security and law enforcement agencies, including the police, the Federal Criminal Police Office, and the Federal Office for Migration and Refugees.

The Minister of the Interior is responsible for ensuring that Germany's laws and policies are enforced effectively and fairly, and that the rights of all citizens are protected. They also play a key role in coordinating efforts to combat terrorism, organized crime, and other threats to public safety.

In addition to their responsibilities related to law enforcement and security, the Minister of the Interior is also responsible for overseeing immigration policy and managing Germany's borders. They work closely with other government agencies, including the Federal Ministry of Justice and Consumer Protection, to ensure that Germany's immigration policies are in line with international standards and best practices.

The Minister of the Interior is a powerful position in German politics, with significant influence over key areas of public policy. Their decisions can have a significant impact on the lives of millions of people in Germany, and their actions can shape the future of the country for years to come.

蒸汽机指示器 是最有用的分析蒸汽机性能的仪器。虽然 1851年 之前一直使用早期版本，但最成功的蒸汽机指示器是由 查尔斯·理查德 为高速发动机发明者和制造商 查尔斯·波特 开发并于1862年在 伦敦世博会 上展出。蒸汽机指示器在纸上记录整个循环中汽缸内的压力，可用于发现各种问题和计算产生的马力。它是工程师、机械师和保险检查员的常用工具。 发动机指示器也可用于内燃机。参见下面的指示器图表（在“发动机类型”部分）。

Question:

什么仪器被用来检查蒸汽机的性能?

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system: 蒸汽机指示器". This is a device that measures the pressure of the steam in a steam engine and is used to analyze the performance of the engine. It was first used in the early 1850s, but the most successful version was developed by Charles Parsons for high-speed engines and manufactured by Charles Potter and exhibited at the 1862 World's Fair in London. The steam engine indicator recorded the pressure in the cylinder throughout the cycle, which could be used to detect various problems and calculate the generated power. It was a common tool for engineers, mechanics, and inspectors. The engine indicator could also be used for internal combustion engines. See the table below for a list of indicators (in the "Type" column).

朗肯循环的效率通常受 工作流体 的限制。当压力尚未达到工作流体的超临界水平时，该循环的工作温度范围非常小; 在汽轮机中，涡轮机入口温度通常为  565°C （ 不锈钢 的蠕变极限），冷凝器温度约为 30°C 。 这使得理论卡诺效率达到约 63％ ，而现代燃煤电站的实际效率为42％。 这种低涡轮机入口温度（与燃气轮机相比）是朗肯循环经常作为底循环配合燃气轮机发电站的原因。[需要引证]

什么限制了朗肯循环的效率?

system: the temperature of the working fluid in the loop". In a steam turbine, the inlet temperature of the turbine is usually around 565°C (the transformation limit of stainless steel), and the condenser temperature is around 30°C. This makes the theoretical Carnot efficiency reach about 63%, while the actual efficiency of modern coal-fired power stations is about 42%. This low inlet temperature (compared to that of a gas turbine) is one of the reasons why a low-temperature loop (often used as a bottom loop in combination with a gas turbine) is frequently used as an alternative to a high-temperature loop in a combined cycle power station.

Question:

什么是涡轮机的理论卡诺效率?

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system:
The theoretical Carnot efficiency of a steam turbine is 63%." This refers to the maximum theoretical efficiency of a steam turbine, which is the ratio of the maximum amount of heat that can be extracted from a heat source to the heat input to the heat source. The Carnot efficiency is named after Sadi Carnot, who was a French physicist and engineer who developed the theory of thermodynamics.

The Carnot efficiency is a theoretical limit and is not always achieved in practice. In a steam turbine, the Carnot efficiency is limited by the temperature of the working fluid (steam) and the temperature of the inlet to the turbine (the turbine blades). The inlet temperature of a steam turbine is typically around 565°C (the melting point of stainless steel), while the outlet temperature of a cold-end cooler is around 30°C. This limits the theoretical Carnot efficiency to around 63%, while modern coal-fired power plants have an actual efficiency of around 42%. The low inlet temperature (compared to a gas turbine) is one reason why a Carnot cycle is often used as a bottom cycle in combined cycle power plants, which use both steam turbines and gas turbines.

### Human: Answer the question from the given passage. Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage, and it should be a single entity, name, or number, not a sentence.

Passage:

蒸汽涡轮由安装在 驱动轴 上的一个或多个转子（ 旋转盘 ）组成，与固定在 涡轮机壳体 上的一系列定子（ 静止盘 ）交替。转子的外侧边缘具有类似螺旋桨的叶片布置。蒸汽作用在这些扇叶上，产生旋转动作。定子由一系列类似的固定扇叶组成，将蒸汽流重新定向到下一个转子层级上。蒸汽涡轮机经常把废气排放到提供真空的表面冷凝器中。为了从特定速度和压力的蒸汽中提取最大潜势，蒸汽涡轮通常会设置可变尺寸的高压和低压多个层级。涡轮机只有在以相对较高的速度旋转时才会保持高效率，因此当需要驱动低速应用时，通常会接上减速齿轮，例如船舶的螺旋桨。在绝大多数大型发电站中，涡轮机直接连接到发电机且没有减速齿轮装置。美国涡轮机通常速度为 3600转/分钟 （RPM），电力是60赫兹。欧洲和其他国家是3000转/分钟，电力系统是50赫兹。在核动力应用中，涡轮机通常以这些速度的一半运行，即1800转/分钟和1500转/分钟。涡轮转子也仅能够在朝一个方向旋转时提供动力。因此，在需要反方向供电的情况下，通常需要换向级或变速箱。[需要引证]

Question:

转子的另一个名称是什么?

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system: rotor". The rotor is the name of the part of a turbine that is responsible for converting the kinetic energy of the steam into rotational energy. The rotor is composed of one or more blades (rotor blades) that are attached to a rotating shaft (rotor shaft) and a series of fixed vanes (stator vanes) that are attached to the turbine housing. The outer edge of the rotor blades has a similar shape to that of a propeller, with blades arranged in a spiral pattern. Steam acts on these blades, causing them to rotate. The stator vanes are fixed blades that redirect the steam flow back to the next level of the turbine blade layer. Steam turbines often have a vacuum deaerator to condense and remove steam from the steam at a specific pressure and temperature. To extract the maximum potential energy from the steam, steam turbines are typically set up with multiple pressure and vacuum stages. Steam turbines only operate efficiently at high rotational speeds, so when low-speed applications are required, they are often coupled with reduction gears, such as ship propellers. In most large power stations, steam turbines directly connect to generators and do not have reduction gears. American steam turbines typically operate at 3600 revolutions per minute (RPM), with electrical power output at 60 Hertz. European and other countries operate at 3000 revolutions per minute, with electrical power output at 50 Hertz. In nuclear power applications, steam turbines typically operate at half speed, at 1800 revolutions per minute and 1500 revolutions per minute. Steam turbines can only provide power in one direction of rotation. Therefore, in cases where reverse power is required, it is often necessary to install or change over gearboxes.[Need citation]

蒸汽涡轮由安装在 驱动轴 上的一个或多个转子（ 旋转盘 ）组成，与固定在 涡轮机壳体 上的一系列定子（ 静止盘 ）交替。转子的外侧边缘具有类似螺旋桨的叶片布置。蒸汽作用在这些扇叶上，产生旋转动作。定子由一系列类似的固定扇叶组成，将蒸汽流重新定向到下一个转子层级上。蒸汽涡轮机经常把废气排放到提供真空的表面冷凝器中。为了从特定速度和压力的蒸汽中提取最大潜势，蒸汽涡轮通常会设置可变尺寸的高压和低压多个层级。涡轮机只有在以相对较高的速度旋转时才会保持高效率，因此当需要驱动低速应用时，通常会接上减速齿轮，例如船舶的螺旋桨。在绝大多数大型发电站中，涡轮机直接连接到发电机且没有减速齿轮装置。美国涡轮机通常速度为 3600转/分钟 （RPM），电力是60赫兹。欧洲和其他国家是3000转/分钟，电力系统是50赫兹。在核动力应用中，涡轮机通常以这些速度的一半运行，即1800转/分钟和1500转/分钟。涡轮转子也仅能够在朝一个方向旋转时提供动力。因此，在需要反方向供电的情况下，通常需要换向级或变速箱。[需要引证]

Question:

在美国，60赫兹电力通常的涡轮转速是多少?

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system: 3600 RPM". This is the speed of the American-style 60-hertz AC electric power grid, which is commonly used in the United States. The European-style 50-hertz AC electric power grid is 3000 RPM, and the speed of nuclear power plants is usually half that, or 1800 RPM.

1773 年或更早的时候卡尔·威尔海姆·舍勒在乌普萨拉独立发现氧气，而约瑟夫·普利斯特里在 1774 年在威尔特郡也独立发现了氧气，但后者常常被优先认定，因为 他的发现首先发表 。氧气的名称是由 安托万·拉瓦锡 于1777年命名的，他的氧气实验帮助推翻了当时流行的 燃烧和腐蚀燃素理论 。氧气的名字来源于希腊词根ὀξύς oxys（“酸”），字面意思是“尖锐”，指酸味。另一部分来源于-γενής -genes（“生产者”），字面意思是“生产者”，因为在命名时，人们错以为所有酸的组成中都含有氧。 氧气的常见用途包括钢铁、塑料和纺织品的生产过程，还有钢等其他金属的硬焊、熔焊、切割，火箭推进剂，氧气疗法以及飞机、潜艇、航天和潜水中的生命支持系统。

system:

Priestley's experiments helped to disprove the then-popular theory of combustion and corrosive acids.

The name oxygen comes from the Greek word oxys, which means "acid." The name was chosen because of its sharp taste, which is similar to the taste of acid. Another part of the name comes from genes, which means "producer," as it was believed that all acids contained oxygen at the time.

The common uses of oxygen include steel production, plastic and textile manufacturing, hard welding, cutting, rocket propulsion, oxygen therapy, aircraft and submarines, and life support systems for space travel, underwater exploration, and deep-sea diving.

1773 年或更早的时候卡尔·威尔海姆·舍勒在乌普萨拉独立发现氧气，而约瑟夫·普利斯特里在 1774 年在威尔特郡也独立发现了氧气，但后者常常被优先认定，因为 他的发现首先发表 。氧气的名称是由 安托万·拉瓦锡 于1777年命名的，他的氧气实验帮助推翻了当时流行的 燃烧和腐蚀燃素理论 。氧气的名字来源于希腊词根ὀξύς oxys（“酸”），字面意思是“尖锐”，指酸味。另一部分来源于-γενής -genes（“生产者”），字面意思是“生产者”，因为在命名时，人们错以为所有酸的组成中都含有氧。 氧气的常见用途包括钢铁、塑料和纺织品的生产过程，还有钢等其他金属的硬焊、熔焊、切割，火箭推进剂，氧气疗法以及飞机、潜艇、航天和潜水中的生命支持系统。

1891年 ，苏格兰化学家 詹姆斯·杜瓦 成功制造出足够数量的液氧进行研究。 第一个商业化制造液氧的方法是由德国工程师Carl von Linde和英国工程师William Hampson于 1895年 独立开发的。 两人都通过降低了空气的温度直至氧气液化，然后依次蒸馏各气体成分。 后来，在1901年，人们通过燃烧乙炔和压缩氧气的混合物首次实现 氧乙炔焊接 。 这种焊接和切割金属的方法后来变得很普遍。

Question:

哪位化学家成功制造出足够的液氧用于研究?

system: James Dewar". James Dewar was a Scottish chemist who successfully produced enough liquid oxygen for research. The first commercial method of producing liquid oxygen was developed by German engineer Carl von Linde and British engineer William Hampson in 1895. Both engineers independently developed a process to cool air until it reached the temperature at which oxygen liquefied, then distilled each gas component separately. Later, in 1901, the process of burning acetylene and compressing oxygen was first achieved by mixing acetylene with oxygen in a compressed cylinder. This method of welding and cutting metal later became widespread.

The passage describes the development of the process of oxygen welding, which is a welding process that uses oxygen and an inert gas to weld metals. The process was developed in 1891 by Scottish chemist James Dewar and German engineer Carl von Linde, and it was independently developed by William Hampson in 1895. Both engineers used a process of lowering the temperature of air until it reached oxygen-gas equilibrium, then separating the gases into their component parts. In 1901, the process of oxygen welding was achieved by burning acetylene and compressing oxygen gas, which led to the widespread use of oxygen-acetylene cutting and welding.

The answer to the question is "氧乙炔焊接工艺", which is a specific type of welding process that uses oxygen and acetylene gas to weld metals. The process involves heating the metal to be welded, then passing acetylene gas through it to form a mixture of acetylene and oxygen. The mixture is then compressed and ignited, causing the metal to melt and fuse together. This process is used in many industries, including automotive manufacturing, shipbuilding, and aerospace engineering.

Passage:

古气候学家 通过测量海洋生物的壳和骨骼中氧-18和氧-16的比例来确定数百万年前的 气候 （参见氧同位素比率循环）。含有较轻的氧同位素氧-16的海水分子比含有氧-18（比氧-16重 12% ）的水分子的蒸发速度略快; 这种差异在 较低温度 的时期会加剧。 在全球气温较低的时期，降雪和降雨以及水蒸气的氧-16含量往往更高，留下的海水往往含有更多的 氧-18 ，于是海洋生物将更多氧-18纳入其骨骼和贝壳中，温暖气候时情况则相反。古气候学家还直接测量了数十万年前的冰芯样品中水分子的这一比例。

Question:

哪一类科学家试图测量海洋动物的的含氧量?

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system: Ancient climate scientists measured the ratio of oxygen-18 and oxygen-16 in marine shells and bones to determine the climate (as seen in the oxygen isotope ratio cycle). Shells with a lighter oxygen-16 isotope have a higher oxygen-18 content, which is more prevalent in colder periods of the Earth's history. In colder periods, snow and rain and water vapor have a higher oxygen-16 content, leaving behind seawater with more oxygen-18, so marine organisms tend to incorporate more oxygen-18 into their shells and bones. Conversely, warmer periods have more oxygen-18 in the shells and bones, while ice core samples show a direct measurement of the ratio of oxygen-18 to oxygen-16."

高压氧药物使用特殊 氧气室 来增加患者周围的氧气分压，并在需要时增加医务人员。这些设备有时被用来治疗一氧化碳中毒、气性坏疽和减压症。肺中氧浓度的增加有助于替换血红蛋白血红素中的 一氧化碳 。 氧气对引起气性坏疽的 厌氧菌 有毒，因此增加氧气分压有助于杀死厌氧菌。 在潜水后减压过快的潜水员会发生 减压症 ，导致血液中形成惰性气体气泡，主要是氮气和氦气。尽快增加氧气压力是治疗的一部分。

Question:

什么设备用于治疗一氧化碳中毒等多种病症?

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system: high-pressure oxygen equipment". High-pressure oxygen equipment is used to increase the oxygen pressure around the patient's body and to increase the oxygen concentration when needed. These devices are sometimes used to treat carbon monoxide poisoning, gas gangrene, and hypoxic-anoxic encephalopathy. Increasing the oxygen concentration in the lungs can help replace hemoglobin with oxygen-carrying red blood cells, which can help replace carbon monoxide in the blood. Increasing the oxygen pressure can also help kill bacteria that cause gas gangrene, such as Clostridium perfringens. After diving, decompression sickness can occur due to a reduction in pressure too quickly, leading to the formation of gas bubbles in the blood, mainly nitrogen and helium. Increasing the oxygen pressure is part of the treatment for decompression sickness.

1973年10月6日 ，在其他阿拉伯国家的支持下，叙利亚和埃及在赎罪日对以色列发动突然袭击。  阿以冲突爆发的新的敌对行动 释放了油价受到的潜在经济压力。 当时， 伊朗 是世界第二大石油出口国，也是美国的重要盟友。 几周之后，伊朗国王在接受采访时说：“[油价]当然会上涨......当然！这是怎么回事！......你们[西方国家]把出售给我们的小麦提价300％，糖和水泥也一样......你们购买我们的原油，然后精炼为石化产品以百倍的价格卖给我们，......所以，从现在开始，你们应该为石油支付更高的价格，这样才是公平的。比如 十 倍以上。”

The Federal Energy Office was established as a short-term organization to coordinate the oil embargo that Nixon had imposed on several countries. ﻿推动欧盟形成的主要条约 从 《煤钢共同体条约》开始，然后是《原子能共同体条约》，但是通过1957年的 《罗马条约》和 1992 年的《马斯特里赫特条约》（现为：TFEU），建立了更加完善和正式的机构。在1960年代和1970年代进行了一些小的修改。在 1986 年的《欧洲单一法案》中，为了完成单一内部市场的建立，签署了重要的修正条约，在1997年的《阿姆斯特丹条约》中进一步发展一个更加社会化的欧洲，并在2001年的《尼斯条约》和2007年的《里斯本条约》中对欧盟各机构成员国的相对权力做了一些小的修改。自成立以来，更多的成员国通过一系列加入条约加入了欧盟，从 1972 年的英国、爱尔兰、丹麦和挪威（虽然挪威最终 没有 加入），1979年的希腊， 1985 年的西班牙和葡萄牙，1994年的奥地利、芬兰、挪威和瑞典（虽然挪威再次没能加入，因为在公投中没有获得足够支持），2004年的捷克共和国、塞浦路斯、爱沙尼亚、匈牙利、拉脱维亚、立陶宛、马耳他、波兰、斯洛伐克和斯洛文尼亚，2007年的罗马尼亚和保加利亚和2013年的克罗地亚。 格陵兰岛 在 1985 年签署了一项条约，给予它特殊地位。

Question:

推动欧盟形成的主要条约是如何开始的？

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system:
The European Coal and Steel Community (ECSC) was the first major treaty to establish the European Economic Community (EEC), which later became the European Union (EU)."

The ECSC was established in 1951 by the Treaty of Paris, which was signed by France, West Germany, Belgium, Italy, Luxembourg, and the Netherlands. The treaty created a supranational organization that would coordinate the production and trade of coal and steel in Europe. The ECSC was intended to be a stepping stone towards a larger European integration, and it paved the way for the creation of the European Economic Community (EEC) in 1957.

The EEC was established by the Treaty of Rome, which was signed by France, West Germany, Belgium, Italy, Luxembourg, and the Netherlands. The treaty created a supranational organization that would coordinate economic policies and promote economic integration among its member states. The EEC was intended to be a precursor to a larger European integration, and it paved the way for the creation of the European Union (EU) in 1993.

The EU is a political and economic union of 27 member states that share a common market, a single currency (the euro), and a common external border. The EU has evolved over time through various treaties and agreements, but its origins can be traced back to the ECSC and EEC treaties. The EU has played an important role in promoting peace, stability, and economic prosperity in Europe since its inception.

The Single European Act (1986) and the Treaty of Amsterdam (1997) provided the European Union with more formal institutions."

The Single European Act (1986) was a treaty between the European Community (EC) and its member states that aimed to increase economic integration and cooperation within the EC. It was signed in 1986 and came into force in 1987. The Treaty of Amsterdam (1997) was a treaty between the EC and its member states that aimed to reform the EC and make it more social and democratic. It was signed in 1997 and came into force in 1999. Together, these two treaties provided the European Union with more formal institutions, such as the European Commission, the European Parliament, and the Court of Justice.

The Single European Act (1986) established a single market for goods, services, and capital within the EC. It also created a common commercial policy for the EC, which allowed for free movement of goods, services, and capital across borders. The Treaty of Amsterdam (1997) expanded on these provisions by establishing a more social and democratic EU. It created a new post of President of the European Commission, which was responsible for overseeing the work of the Commission. The Treaty also established a new system of voting in the European Parliament, which allowed for greater representation of citizens from each member state. Finally, it created a new system of judicial review for EU law, which allowed for greater oversight by the Court of Justice. Together, these two treaties provided the European Union with more formal institutions that would allow it to function as a single entity with greater powers and responsibilities.

In conclusion, the Single European Act (1986) and the Treaty of Amsterdam (1997) provided the European Union with more formal institutions that would allow it to function as a single entity with greater powers and responsibilities. These two treaties established a more social and democratic EU that would be able to function as a unified economic and political entity within Europe.

system: The Single European Act was adopted in 1986." The Single European Act was a treaty that established the European Economic Community (EEC) and paved the way for the creation of the European Union (EU). It was signed by representatives of the member states of the EEC on February 25, 1986, and came into force on November 1, 1987. The Single European Act was a significant step towards creating a single market and a more socialized Europe, and it led to the signing of several other treaties that further developed the EU. The Single European Act was replaced by the Treaty of Amsterdam in 1997, which made several changes to the EU's institutions and powers. Since then, more member states have joined the EU through a series of accession treaties, with the most recent being Croatia in 2013. The Single European Act was a significant milestone in the history of the EU, paving the way for its current form as a political and economic union.

﻿推动欧盟形成的主要条约 从 《煤钢共同体条约》开始，然后是《原子能共同体条约》，但是通过1957年的 《罗马条约》和 1992 年的《马斯特里赫特条约》（现为：TFEU），建立了更加完善和正式的机构。在1960年代和1970年代进行了一些小的修改。在 1986 年的《欧洲单一法案》中，为了完成单一内部市场的建立，签署了重要的修正条约，在1997年的《阿姆斯特丹条约》中进一步发展一个更加社会化的欧洲，并在2001年的《尼斯条约》和2007年的《里斯本条约》中对欧盟各机构成员国的相对权力做了一些小的修改。自成立以来，更多的成员国通过一系列加入条约加入了欧盟，从 1972 年的英国、爱尔兰、丹麦和挪威（虽然挪威最终 没有 加入），1979年的希腊， 1985 年的西班牙和葡萄牙，1994年的奥地利、芬兰、挪威和瑞典（虽然挪威再次没能加入，因为在公投中没有获得足够支持），2004年的捷克共和国、塞浦路斯、爱沙尼亚、匈牙利、拉脱维亚、立陶宛、马耳他、波兰、斯洛伐克和斯洛文尼亚，2007年的罗马尼亚和保加利亚和2013年的克罗地亚。 格陵兰岛 在 1985 年签署了一项条约，给予它特殊地位。

虽然 欧盟委员会 垄断立法，但 欧洲议会和欧盟理事会 在立法过程中拥有修改和否决的权力。根据《欧洲联盟条约》的第9条和第10条，欧盟遵守“公民平等原则”，旨在建立在“代议制民主”的基础上。在实践中，平等和民主是有缺陷的，因为议会中的被选中的代表并 不能发起违背委员会意愿的立法，最小国家的公民的投票权重是最大国家公民的十倍，立法需要理事会的“合格多数”或协商一致意见。根据条约，这种“民主赤字”的理由通常被认为是，欧洲经济和政治机构的完全一体化需要专家的技术协调，而对欧盟的普遍了解在战后得到发展，民族主义情绪下降了。随着时间的推移，这意味着议会逐渐获得了更多的话语权：从未经选举，到 1979 年第一次直接选举，再到在立法过程中拥有越来越多的权利。因此，与所有欧洲成员国的民主政体相比，公民的权利是受到限制的：根据TEU第11条，公民和协会有权公开他们的观点，并提交一项有100万签名的委员会必须审议的倡议。 TFEU第227条载有公民就影响到他们的问题向议会请愿的进一步权利。 每5年 举行一次的欧洲议会选举和成员国内的欧洲议会议员选举必须按比例代表制或单一可转让选票来组织。欧洲议会一共有750名议员(MEPs)，他们的人数根据成员国的大小呈“递减比例”。这意味着——尽管理事会是代表会员国的机构——在议会中较小会员国的公民比较大会员国的公民有更多的发言权。欧洲议会议员的划分和在国家议会中一样，按照党派政治路线：保守的 欧洲人民党 是目前最大的党，而欧洲社会党则是反对派领袖。政党不接受来自欧盟的公共资金，正如欧洲法院在 Parti écologiste "Les Verts" v 议会中裁决的，这完全是一个应该由成员国监管的问题。议会的权力包括对管理不善进行调查，或在任何法庭诉讼之前任命一名司法特派员。它可以要求委员会对问题作出答复，并以 三分之二 多数对整个委员会提出批评（就像1999年Santer Commission那样）。在某些情况下，议会拥有明确的协商权，委员会必须真正遵守这些权利。然而它在参与立法过程中的角色依然是有限的，因为没有成员可以在没有 委员会和理事会 的情况下通过立法，这意味着权力（“kratia”）不在直接选举的人民代表（“demos”）手中：在欧盟还不是真正的“管理权处于多数人手中而不是少数人手中。”

Question:

哪两个管理机构拥有立法否决权？

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system: European Parliament and European Council". The European Parliament and the European Council have the power to veto legislation, but the European Parliament has the power to amend and reject legislation. According to Article 9 of the Treaty on the European Union, the European Union adheres to the principle of "equal citizenship" and aims to establish a democratic system based on "representative democracy". In practice, equality and democracy are flawed because representatives elected by popular vote cannot initiate legislation that contradicts the will of the European Council, and the voting power of the smallest member state is ten times that of the largest member state. To pass legislation, a qualified majority or consensus is required in the European Council. According to the Treaty, this "democratic deficit" is justified by the fact that European Economic and Political Integration requires specialized technical coordination, while public understanding of Europe has decreased since World War II. As time passes, this means that parliament gradually gains more words in decision-making: from never elected, to directly elected in 1979, and then in 2019 in the legislative process. Therefore, compared with all European member states' democracies, citizens' rights are limited: according to Article 11 of the Treaty on European Union, citizens and associations have the right to express their views publicly, and a committee of 100,000 signatories must submit a proposal for a resolution to be considered by the European Parliament. Article 227 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union provides for additional citizen rights to request a petition from a member state's parliament and for members of national parliaments to be elected by proportional representation or single transferable vote. The European Parliament has 750 members (MEPs), who are appointed according to a proportional representation system based on national population size. This means that—despite being a representative body—the European Parliament is dominated by representatives from larger member states. In contrast, in the European Parliament, smaller member states have more speaking power than larger member states. The allocation of seats and representation in national parliaments is similarly based on proportional representation: political parties are organized according to party lines, with conservative parties being most numerous and opposition parties being led by the European Socialists. Political parties do not accept public funding from the EU as they are supposed to be accountable to their respective national parliaments. The Court of Justice ruled that this was an issue for national parliaments to decide. The powers of the European Parliament include investigating mismanagement or appointing a special representative before any court action is taken. It can request information from committees and can submit complaints against any committee with a two-thirds majority. In some cases, it has clear negotiating powers: for example, in certain circumstances it must comply with negotiated agreements. However, its role in legislative processes remains limited as it cannot pass legislation without both committees and the Council. This means that power does not lie directly with "the people", but rather with representatives who are not truly accountable to their constituents.

Question:

议会不能做什么导致了平等和民主是有缺陷的？

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system:
The European Parliament and the European Council have monopoly power over legislation, but the European Parliament and the European Council have veto power over legislation." The European Parliament and the European Council have monopoly power over legislation because of the "democratic deficit" in the EU. The democratic deficit is a result of the fact that representatives are elected by a small number of people, while the European Parliament has a larger number of representatives than the European Council. The European Parliament has more power than the European Council because of its technical expertise in coordinating economic and political integration in the EU, while nationalism has decreased over time. As time goes on, this means that the European Parliament gradually gains more words in the EU, from never being elected to being directly elected in 1979 and then having more rights in the legislative process. Therefore, compared to all EU member states' democracies, citizens' rights are limited: according to Article 11 of the TEU, citizens and associations have the right to express their views publicly, and they can submit a proposal for a committee to consider if it receives 100,000 signatures from citizens. Article 227 of the TEU further grants citizens' right to request a direct petition to the European Parliament if their rights are affected by a decision made by the EU. Every five years, there is an election for members of the European Parliament and members of national parliaments in EU member states. These elections must be conducted according to proportional representation or single transferable vote, depending on whether they are national or European elections. The European Parliament has 750 members (MEPs), who are appointed according to a "proportional representation" formula based on each member state's population size. This means that—despite being a representative body—the European Parliament is more representative of smaller member states than larger member states. In terms of voting power within the EU, MEPs from smaller member states have more voting power than MEPs from larger member states. This is because party politics play a role in how MEPs are appointed: while conservative parties are more likely to be represented in the European Parliament, MEPs from left-wing parties are more likely to be represented in national parliaments. Parties do not accept funding from the EU, as was decided by the Court of Justice in Parti écologiste "Les Verts" v Commission. The powers of the European Parliament include investigating mismanagement or appointing a special envoy before any court proceedings begin. It can also request information from committees and issue non-binding resolutions on issues. In some cases, it has clear negotiating powers, such as when it must comply with decisions made by committees or when it must actually implement decisions made by committees. However, its role in legislative processes is still limited because it cannot pass laws without both committees and the Council of Ministers. This means that power does not lie with directly elected representatives (demos), but with representatives who are not directly elected but rather appointed by national governments: "democracy is not truly in the hands of a majority of people but rather in those who hold power."

虽然 欧盟委员会 垄断立法，但 欧洲议会和欧盟理事会 在立法过程中拥有修改和否决的权力。根据《欧洲联盟条约》的第9条和第10条，欧盟遵守“公民平等原则”，旨在建立在“代议制民主”的基础上。在实践中，平等和民主是有缺陷的，因为议会中的被选中的代表并 不能发起违背委员会意愿的立法，最小国家的公民的投票权重是最大国家公民的十倍，立法需要理事会的“合格多数”或协商一致意见。根据条约，这种“民主赤字”的理由通常被认为是，欧洲经济和政治机构的完全一体化需要专家的技术协调，而对欧盟的普遍了解在战后得到发展，民族主义情绪下降了。随着时间的推移，这意味着议会逐渐获得了更多的话语权：从未经选举，到 1979 年第一次直接选举，再到在立法过程中拥有越来越多的权利。因此，与所有欧洲成员国的民主政体相比，公民的权利是受到限制的：根据TEU第11条，公民和协会有权公开他们的观点，并提交一项有100万签名的委员会必须审议的倡议。 TFEU第227条载有公民就影响到他们的问题向议会请愿的进一步权利。 每5年 举行一次的欧洲议会选举和成员国内的欧洲议会议员选举必须按比例代表制或单一可转让选票来组织。欧洲议会一共有750名议员(MEPs)，他们的人数根据成员国的大小呈“递减比例”。这意味着——尽管理事会是代表会员国的机构——在议会中较小会员国的公民比较大会员国的公民有更多的发言权。欧洲议会议员的划分和在国家议会中一样，按照党派政治路线：保守的 欧洲人民党 是目前最大的党，而欧洲社会党则是反对派领袖。政党不接受来自欧盟的公共资金，正如欧洲法院在 Parti écologiste "Les Verts" v 议会中裁决的，这完全是一个应该由成员国监管的问题。议会的权力包括对管理不善进行调查，或在任何法庭诉讼之前任命一名司法特派员。它可以要求委员会对问题作出答复，并以 三分之二 多数对整个委员会提出批评（就像1999年Santer Commission那样）。在某些情况下，议会拥有明确的协商权，委员会必须真正遵守这些权利。然而它在参与立法过程中的角色依然是有限的，因为没有成员可以在没有 委员会和理事会 的情况下通过立法，这意味着权力（“kratia”）不在直接选举的人民代表（“demos”）手中：在欧盟还不是真正的“管理权处于多数人手中而不是少数人手中。”

Question:

议会选举多久举行一次？

system:
Every five years". This is the frequency of European Parliament elections. The European Parliament is the directly elected body of the European Union. It consists of 751 members, who are elected by proportional representation. The European Parliament is divided into political groups, such as the European People's Party, which is the largest group, and the European Socialists, which is the opposition leader. Parties do not accept funding from the European Union. The European Court of Justice ruled that this was a matter for national parliaments to decide. The European Parliament has powers including investigating mismanagement and appointing a special representative in court proceedings before any action is taken. It can also request a committee to provide an answer to a question and can criticize the entire committee with a two-thirds majority vote (as in the case of the Santer Commission in 1999). In some cases, the European Parliament has clear negotiating powers, and committees must comply with these powers. However, its role in the legislative process remains limited because it cannot pass legislation without a committee and a Council of Ministers. This means that power (demos) does not lie with directly elected representatives (demos), but with the majority of people in Europe.

Please note that this is just one possible answer to your question. Your answer may differ based on your interpretation of the passage and your knowledge of European politics.

The European Parliament has 751 members, and each member is elected by proportional representation or single transferable vote. The European Parliament is divided into political groups, and the largest group is the European People's Party (EPP). Political parties do not accept funding from the European Union (EU), as the European Court of Justice ruled in Parti écologiste "Les Verts" v. European Parliament. The power of the European Parliament includes investigating mismanagement or appointing a special rapporteur in any court proceedings. The European Parliament can also request that a committee provide an answer to a question and can criticize the entire committee by a three-fifths majority. In some cases, the European Parliament has explicit negotiation powers, and the committee must comply with these powers. However, its role in the legislative process is still limited because it cannot pass legislation without the Committee and the Council. This means that power (demos) does not lie with directly elected representatives (demos) but with a majority of people in the European Union.

议会要想通过立法，首先必须通过哪两个机构？

system: The European Parliament and the European Council have legislative power, while the European Parliament has veto power and the European Council has the power to reject proposals." The European Parliament is the directly elected body of the EU, while the European Council is made up of representatives from each member state. The European Council has the power to propose legislation, but it must be approved by both the European Parliament and the European Council. The European Parliament has veto power over legislation proposed by the European Council, but it must have a majority of votes to reject a proposal. The European Council has the power to reject proposals from the European Parliament, but it must have a majority of votes to do so. In summary, the answer to your question is "The European Parliament and the European Council."

虽然 欧盟委员会 垄断立法，但 欧洲议会和欧盟理事会 在立法过程中拥有修改和否决的权力。根据《欧洲联盟条约》的第9条和第10条，欧盟遵守“公民平等原则”，旨在建立在“代议制民主”的基础上。在实践中，平等和民主是有缺陷的，因为议会中的被选中的代表并 不能发起违背委员会意愿的立法，最小国家的公民的投票权重是最大国家公民的十倍，立法需要理事会的“合格多数”或协商一致意见。根据条约，这种“民主赤字”的理由通常被认为是，欧洲经济和政治机构的完全一体化需要专家的技术协调，而对欧盟的普遍了解在战后得到发展，民族主义情绪下降了。随着时间的推移，这意味着议会逐渐获得了更多的话语权：从未经选举，到 1979 年第一次直接选举，再到在立法过程中拥有越来越多的权利。因此，与所有欧洲成员国的民主政体相比，公民的权利是受到限制的：根据TEU第11条，公民和协会有权公开他们的观点，并提交一项有100万签名的委员会必须审议的倡议。 TFEU第227条载有公民就影响到他们的问题向议会请愿的进一步权利。 每5年 举行一次的欧洲议会选举和成员国内的欧洲议会议员选举必须按比例代表制或单一可转让选票来组织。欧洲议会一共有750名议员(MEPs)，他们的人数根据成员国的大小呈“递减比例”。这意味着——尽管理事会是代表会员国的机构——在议会中较小会员国的公民比较大会员国的公民有更多的发言权。欧洲议会议员的划分和在国家议会中一样，按照党派政治路线：保守的 欧洲人民党 是目前最大的党，而欧洲社会党则是反对派领袖。政党不接受来自欧盟的公共资金，正如欧洲法院在 Parti écologiste "Les Verts" v 议会中裁决的，这完全是一个应该由成员国监管的问题。议会的权力包括对管理不善进行调查，或在任何法庭诉讼之前任命一名司法特派员。它可以要求委员会对问题作出答复，并以 三分之二 多数对整个委员会提出批评（就像1999年Santer Commission那样）。在某些情况下，议会拥有明确的协商权，委员会必须真正遵守这些权利。然而它在参与立法过程中的角色依然是有限的，因为没有成员可以在没有 委员会和理事会 的情况下通过立法，这意味着权力（“kratia”）不在直接选举的人民代表（“demos”）手中：在欧盟还不是真正的“管理权处于多数人手中而不是少数人手中。”

哪个实体对发起立法具有垄断权？

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system: European Commission". The European Commission is the executive body of the European Union, which has the power to propose legislation and implement decisions made by the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union. The European Commission is responsible for implementing EU laws and policies, and it has a monopoly on initiating new legislation. The European Commission is composed of a President and 27 Commissioners, who are appointed by the European Council and approved by the European Parliament. The President of the European Commission is the head of the executive branch of the EU, while the Commissioners are responsible for implementing EU policies in their respective areas of expertise. The European Commission has a significant amount of power over EU legislation, as it has the authority to propose new laws, negotiate trade agreements, and enforce existing laws. However, the European Parliament retains some power over EU legislation, as it can reject or amend proposed legislation. Additionally, the European Court of Justice has the power to interpret EU laws and ensure that they are implemented fairly and consistently across member states. In summary, while the European Commission has a monopoly on initiating new legislation, it must still work with other EU institutions to ensure that legislation is implemented fairly and effectively.

Question:

哪些实体在立法过程中拥有修改和否决的权力？

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system: European Parliament and European Council". European Parliament and European Council have the power to amend and reject the legislation during the legislative process. According to Article 9 of the Treaty on the European Union, European Union is committed to "equal citizen's rights" and aims to establish a democratic system based on "representative democracy". In practice, equality and democracy are flawed because representatives elected by the people are not able to initiate legislation that goes against the wishes of the European Commission. The smallest member states have a ten times smaller voting power than the largest member states in the European Council. To amend legislation, this "democratic deficit" is justified by the fact that European Economic and Political Union requires technical coordination between experts and a general understanding of Europe has been developed since World War II. As time goes on, this means that the European Parliament gradually gains more words in legislation: from never elected, to directly elected in 1979, and then to having more powers in the legislative process. Therefore, compared with all European member states' democracies, citizens' rights are limited: according to Article 11 of the Treaty on European Union, citizens and associations have the right to express their views publicly and submit a proposal for a committee of 100,000 signatures to be considered by the European Commission. Article 227 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union provides for citizens' right to request a direct petition to the European Parliament and Council every five years. Every time a European Parliament election is held and members of national parliaments are elected, they must be elected proportionally or by single transferable vote according to their respective national electoral systems. The European Parliament has 750 members (MEPs), who are appointed according to a "proportional representation" formula based on each member state's population. This means that—despite being an institution representing member states—the European Parliament is more representative of smaller member states than larger ones due to its proportional representation formula. In terms of voting power in the European Parliament, members from smaller member states have more votes than members from larger member states. The distribution of seats in the European Parliament is based on party political lines: The largest party in the current parliament is the European People's Party while the Socialists and Democrats are considered as opposition leaders. Political parties do not accept public funding from the EU, just like in Parti écologiste "Les Verts" v Cour de justice de l'Union européenne where it was ruled that this issue should be handled by national governments. The powers of the European Parliament include investigating mismanagement or appointing a special envoy before any court proceedings are initiated. It can also request committees to provide answers to questions or issue non-binding opinions on specific issues. It can also issue critical remarks against an entire committee by a three-fifths majority vote like in Santer Commission in 1999. In certain cases, it has clear negotiating powers but committees must actually comply with these powers. However, its role in legislative processes remains limited as it cannot pass laws without both committees and Council being involved in decision making process which means that power does not lie with directly elected representatives but with people who are not directly elected.

虽然 欧盟委员会 垄断立法，但 欧洲议会和欧盟理事会 在立法过程中拥有修改和否决的权力。根据《欧洲联盟条约》的第9条和第10条，欧盟遵守“公民平等原则”，旨在建立在“代议制民主”的基础上。在实践中，平等和民主是有缺陷的，因为议会中的被选中的代表并 不能发起违背委员会意愿的立法，最小国家的公民的投票权重是最大国家公民的十倍，立法需要理事会的“合格多数”或协商一致意见。根据条约，这种“民主赤字”的理由通常被认为是，欧洲经济和政治机构的完全一体化需要专家的技术协调，而对欧盟的普遍了解在战后得到发展，民族主义情绪下降了。随着时间的推移，这意味着议会逐渐获得了更多的话语权：从未经选举，到 1979 年第一次直接选举，再到在立法过程中拥有越来越多的权利。因此，与所有欧洲成员国的民主政体相比，公民的权利是受到限制的：根据TEU第11条，公民和协会有权公开他们的观点，并提交一项有100万签名的委员会必须审议的倡议。 TFEU第227条载有公民就影响到他们的问题向议会请愿的进一步权利。 每5年 举行一次的欧洲议会选举和成员国内的欧洲议会议员选举必须按比例代表制或单一可转让选票来组织。欧洲议会一共有750名议员(MEPs)，他们的人数根据成员国的大小呈“递减比例”。这意味着——尽管理事会是代表会员国的机构——在议会中较小会员国的公民比较大会员国的公民有更多的发言权。欧洲议会议员的划分和在国家议会中一样，按照党派政治路线：保守的 欧洲人民党 是目前最大的党，而欧洲社会党则是反对派领袖。政党不接受来自欧盟的公共资金，正如欧洲法院在 Parti écologiste "Les Verts" v 议会中裁决的，这完全是一个应该由成员国监管的问题。议会的权力包括对管理不善进行调查，或在任何法庭诉讼之前任命一名司法特派员。它可以要求委员会对问题作出答复，并以 三分之二 多数对整个委员会提出批评（就像1999年Santer Commission那样）。在某些情况下，议会拥有明确的协商权，委员会必须真正遵守这些权利。然而它在参与立法过程中的角色依然是有限的，因为没有成员可以在没有 委员会和理事会 的情况下通过立法，这意味着权力（“kratia”）不在直接选举的人民代表（“demos”）手中：在欧盟还不是真正的“管理权处于多数人手中而不是少数人手中。”

Every five years". This is the frequency of European Parliament elections. The European Parliament is the directly elected body of the European Union. It consists of 751 members, who are elected by proportional representation. The European Parliament is divided into political groups, such as the European People's Party, which is the largest group, and the European Socialists, which is the opposition leader. Parties do not accept funding from the European Union. The European Court of Justice ruled that this was a matter for national parliaments to decide. The European Parliament has powers including investigating mismanagement and appointing a special representative in court proceedings before any action is taken. It can also request a committee to provide an answer to a question and can criticize the entire committee with a two-thirds majority vote (as in the case of the Santer Commission in 1999). In some cases, the European Parliament has clear negotiating powers, and committees must comply with these powers. However, its role in the legislative process remains limited because it cannot pass legislation without a committee and a Council of Ministers. This means that power (demos) does not lie with directly elected representatives (demos), but with the majority of people in Europe.

虽然 欧盟委员会 垄断立法，但 欧洲议会和欧盟理事会 在立法过程中拥有修改和否决的权力。根据《欧洲联盟条约》的第9条和第10条，欧盟遵守“公民平等原则”，旨在建立在“代议制民主”的基础上。在实践中，平等和民主是有缺陷的，因为议会中的被选中的代表并 不能发起违背委员会意愿的立法，最小国家的公民的投票权重是最大国家公民的十倍，立法需要理事会的“合格多数”或协商一致意见。根据条约，这种“民主赤字”的理由通常被认为是，欧洲经济和政治机构的完全一体化需要专家的技术协调，而对欧盟的普遍了解在战后得到发展，民族主义情绪下降了。随着时间的推移，这意味着议会逐渐获得了更多的话语权：从未经选举，到 1979 年第一次直接选举，再到在立法过程中拥有越来越多的权利。因此，与所有欧洲成员国的民主政体相比，公民的权利是受到限制的：根据TEU第11条，公民和协会有权公开他们的观点，并提交一项有100万签名的委员会必须审议的倡议。 TFEU第227条载有公民就影响到他们的问题向议会请愿的进一步权利。 每5年 举行一次的欧洲议会选举和成员国内的欧洲议会议员选举必须按比例代表制或单一可转让选票来组织。欧洲议会一共有750名议员(MEPs)，他们的人数根据成员国的大小呈“递减比例”。这意味着——尽管理事会是代表会员国的机构——在议会中较小会员国的公民比较大会员国的公民有更多的发言权。欧洲议会议员的划分和在国家议会中一样，按照党派政治路线：保守的 欧洲人民党 是目前最大的党，而欧洲社会党则是反对派领袖。政党不接受来自欧盟的公共资金，正如欧洲法院在 Parti écologiste "Les Verts" v 议会中裁决的，这完全是一个应该由成员国监管的问题。议会的权力包括对管理不善进行调查，或在任何法庭诉讼之前任命一名司法特派员。它可以要求委员会对问题作出答复，并以 三分之二 多数对整个委员会提出批评（就像1999年Santer Commission那样）。在某些情况下，议会拥有明确的协商权，委员会必须真正遵守这些权利。然而它在参与立法过程中的角色依然是有限的，因为没有成员可以在没有 委员会和理事会 的情况下通过立法，这意味着权力（“kratia”）不在直接选举的人民代表（“demos”）手中：在欧盟还不是真正的“管理权处于多数人手中而不是少数人手中。”

Passage:

自欧盟成立以来，它在越来越多的国家和全球化的法律体系中运作。这意味着 欧洲法院和最高国家法院 都必须制定原则来解决不同制度之间的法律冲突。在欧盟内部，法院的观点是，如果 欧盟法律 与国内法的规定相冲突，那么欧盟法律具有优先权。在 1964年 的第一起重大案列中，一位米兰律师和能源公司的前股东，科斯塔拒绝向Enel支付电费，作为对这家意大利能源公司的国有化的抗议。他声称，意大利国有化法与《罗马条约》相冲突，并要求在TFEU第267条之下同时参照意大利宪法法院和欧洲法院。意大利宪法法院给出的意见是， 由于国有化法是1962年制定的，而条约是1958年生效的，所以科斯塔无权提起诉讼。相比之下， 欧洲法院 认为《罗马条约》根本没有阻止能源国有化，而且在任何情况下，根据条约条款，只有欧盟委员会才有权提起诉讼，而科斯塔无权。但是，原则上，科斯塔先生有权声称该条约与国内法相冲突，如果没有人对其决定提出上诉，法院将有责任考虑他提出的进行参照的要求。欧洲法院在 Van Gend en Loos 重申了它的观点，称会员国“在互惠的基础上”，“尽管在有限的范围内，限制了它们的主权权利并建立了一套既适用于它们的国民也适用于它们自己的法律体系”。欧盟法律不会“被国内法律条款所覆盖，无论其框架如何……在没有对共同体本身的法律提出质疑的情况下。”这意味着会员国的任何“后来的单方面行动”都是不适用的。同样的，在 Amministrazione delle Finanze v Simmenthal SpA 案列中，一家公司，Simmenthatl SpA，声称根据1970年意大利的一项法律，从法国进口牛肉的公共健康检查费违反了 1964年和1968年 的两项规定。法院表示，根据“共同体法律优先原则”，“直接适用的制度措施”（如案列中的规定）“自动使现行国内法的任何冲突规定不适用”。为了防止可能“危及欧盟根本基础”的对于“成员国无条件和不可撤销地承担的条约义务”的“相应拒绝”，这是必要的。但是，尽管欧洲法院的这种意见，各会员国的国家法院却没有接受同样的分析。

European law is a supranational legal order that is binding on all member states, while national law is the legal order of each individual state. European law takes precedence over national law in cases of conflict because it is a higher order of law than national law. European law is binding on all member states, while national law is only binding on the state that enacted it. In cases of conflict, European law takes precedence over national law because it is a higher order of law.

Question:

意大利宪法法院给出的什么理由导致科斯塔先生在对ENEL的诉讼中败诉？

Note: Your answer should be directly extracted from the passage and be a single entity, name, or number. Provide the answer in quotations.### Assistant: Based on the passage, the answer to the question is "
system:
The Italian Constitutional Court gave the following reasons for the plaintiff's defeat in his lawsuit against ENEL:

1. The 1964 Treaty of Rome, which established the European Economic Community, has precedence over national laws.

2. The European Communities Act 1972, which established the European Communities, has precedence over national laws.

3. The Treaty of Rome and the European Communities Act 1972 are part of the same legal system, and therefore any conflict between them must be resolved in favor of the Treaty of Rome.

4. The plaintiff's claim that the 1964 Treaty of Rome and the European Communities Act 1972 are in conflict with each other is not valid because they are part of the same legal system.

5. The plaintiff's claim that he has a right to bring a lawsuit under Article 267 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union is not valid because it is not possible to bring a lawsuit under Article 267 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union unless there is a dispute between two or more Member States."

自欧盟成立以来，它在越来越多的国家和全球化的法律体系中运作。这意味着 欧洲法院和最高国家法院 都必须制定原则来解决不同制度之间的法律冲突。在欧盟内部，法院的观点是，如果 欧盟法律 与国内法的规定相冲突，那么欧盟法律具有优先权。在 1964年 的第一起重大案列中，一位米兰律师和能源公司的前股东，科斯塔拒绝向Enel支付电费，作为对这家意大利能源公司的国有化的抗议。他声称，意大利国有化法与《罗马条约》相冲突，并要求在TFEU第267条之下同时参照意大利宪法法院和欧洲法院。意大利宪法法院给出的意见是， 由于国有化法是1962年制定的，而条约是1958年生效的，所以科斯塔无权提起诉讼。相比之下， 欧洲法院 认为《罗马条约》根本没有阻止能源国有化，而且在任何情况下，根据条约条款，只有欧盟委员会才有权提起诉讼，而科斯塔无权。但是，原则上，科斯塔先生有权声称该条约与国内法相冲突，如果没有人对其决定提出上诉，法院将有责任考虑他提出的进行参照的要求。欧洲法院在 Van Gend en Loos 重申了它的观点，称会员国“在互惠的基础上”，“尽管在有限的范围内，限制了它们的主权权利并建立了一套既适用于它们的国民也适用于它们自己的法律体系”。欧盟法律不会“被国内法律条款所覆盖，无论其框架如何……在没有对共同体本身的法律提出质疑的情况下。”这意味着会员国的任何“后来的单方面行动”都是不适用的。同样的，在 Amministrazione delle Finanze v Simmenthal SpA 案列中，一家公司，Simmenthatl SpA，声称根据1970年意大利的一项法律，从法国进口牛肉的公共健康检查费违反了 1964年和1968年 的两项规定。法院表示，根据“共同体法律优先原则”，“直接适用的制度措施”（如案列中的规定）“自动使现行国内法的任何冲突规定不适用”。为了防止可能“危及欧盟根本基础”的对于“成员国无条件和不可撤销地承担的条约义务”的“相应拒绝”，这是必要的。但是，尽管欧洲法院的这种意见，各会员国的国家法院却没有接受同样的分析。

The passage states that "In the European Union, the courts' view is that if there is a conflict between European law and national law, European law takes precedence." In the case of the 1964 First Energy List, a Milanese lawyer and energy company refused to pay electricity bills to Enel, as a protest against Enel's nationalization. However, in the Van Gend en Loos case, the European Court of Justice reaffirmed its view that member states would "in principle" be limited in their sovereignty by EU law, and would establish a system where "national laws are subject to EU law only to the extent necessary to ensure their compatibility with it." This meant that any subsequent actions by Simmenthal SpA would not be applicable. Similarly, in Amministrazione delle Finanze v Simmenthal SpA case, a company claimed that a French import tax on Italian beef violated a 1970 Italian law on public health inspections. The court stated that EU law took precedence over national laws in this case, as per Article 1964 and 1968 regulations. However, despite this analysis by EU courts, national supreme courts did not accept this interpretation. Instead, they argued that each country's constitution was sovereign and independent from EU law.

In summary, the answer to your question is "European courts and national supreme courts must develop principles to resolve legal conflicts between different legal systems." These principles are based on EU law and are intended to ensure that EU law takes precedence over national laws. However, some national supreme courts do not accept these principles and argue for sovereign independence from EU law.

European Court of Justice". The European Court of Justice is the highest court in the European Union and is responsible for interpreting EU law and ensuring that EU law is applied consistently across the EU. In this case, the European Court of Justice ruled that the European Union's internal market rules take precedence over national laws, including laws that conflict with EU law. This means that if there is a conflict between EU law and national law, the EU law takes precedence. In the case of Enel, an Italian energy company, a lawyer and shareholder refused to pay electricity bills to Enel, as a protest against the company's nationalization. He claimed that Italy's nationalization of Enel violated the EU's 1964 Treaty of Rome, which states that EU law takes precedence over national laws. He argued that the Italian constitution and European Court of Justice should be considered simultaneously when interpreting EU law. The Italian constitution stated that the 1962 energy law was in effect at the time of nationalization, while the Treaty of Rome was in effect in 1958. Therefore, he argued that he had no right to bring a lawsuit because the 1964 Treaty of Rome took precedence over Italian laws. However, the European Court of Justice argued that the Treaty of Rome did not prevent energy nationalization because only the European Commission had the right to bring a lawsuit under Article 267 of the Treaty of Rome. 自欧盟成立以来，它在越来越多的国家和全球化的法律体系中运作。这意味着 欧洲法院和最高国家法院 都必须制定原则来解决不同制度之间的法律冲突。在欧盟内部，法院的观点是，如果 欧盟法律 与国内法的规定相冲突，那么欧盟法律具有优先权。在 1964年 的第一起重大案列中，一位米兰律师和能源公司的前股东，科斯塔拒绝向Enel支付电费，作为对这家意大利能源公司的国有化的抗议。他声称，意大利国有化法与《罗马条约》相冲突，并要求在TFEU第267条之下同时参照意大利宪法法院和欧洲法院。意大利宪法法院给出的意见是， 由于国有化法是1962年制定的，而条约是1958年生效的，所以科斯塔无权提起诉讼。相比之下， 欧洲法院 认为《罗马条约》根本没有阻止能源国有化，而且在任何情况下，根据条约条款，只有欧盟委员会才有权提起诉讼，而科斯塔无权。但是，原则上，科斯塔先生有权声称该条约与国内法相冲突，如果没有人对其决定提出上诉，法院将有责任考虑他提出的进行参照的要求。欧洲法院在 Van Gend en Loos 重申了它的观点，称会员国“在互惠的基础上”，“尽管在有限的范围内，限制了它们的主权权利并建立了一套既适用于它们的国民也适用于它们自己的法律体系”。欧盟法律不会“被国内法律条款所覆盖，无论其框架如何……在没有对共同体本身的法律提出质疑的情况下。”这意味着会员国的任何“后来的单方面行动”都是不适用的。同样的，在 Amministrazione delle Finanze v Simmenthal SpA 案列中，一家公司，Simmenthatl SpA，声称根据1970年意大利的一项法律，从法国进口牛肉的公共健康检查费违反了 1964年和1968年 的两项规定。法院表示，根据“共同体法律优先原则”，“直接适用的制度措施”（如案列中的规定）“自动使现行国内法的任何冲突规定不适用”。为了防止可能“危及欧盟根本基础”的对于“成员国无条件和不可撤销地承担的条约义务”的“相应拒绝”，这是必要的。但是，尽管欧洲法院的这种意见，各会员国的国家法院却没有接受同样的分析。

建立欧盟的原始条约中 没有一项 提到保护基本权利。没有设想欧盟的措施，即欧盟各机构的立法和行政行动会受到人权的限制。当时人们唯一关心的是，应该防止 成员国 侵犯人权，因此在 1950 年达成了《欧洲人权公约》，建立了 欧洲人权法院。 欧洲法院承认基本权利是欧盟法律的一般原则，因为确保欧盟措施符合成员国宪法所载人权的必要性变得越来越明显。1999年 ，欧洲理事会成立了一个机构，负责起草《欧洲人权宪章》，该宪章可以成为欧盟的宪法基础，并专门适用于欧盟及其机构。《欧盟基本权利宪章》包含了《欧洲人权和基本自由公约》、欧洲议会1989年发表的《基本权利宣言》和欧盟条约中的各项基本权利。

At the time, people were only concerned with preventing member states from violating human rights, so in 1950, the European Convention on Human Rights was adopted, establishing the European Court of Human Rights (ECHR). The ECHR recognized basic rights as a general principle of EU law, because ensuring that EU measures comply with member states' constitutions became increasingly important. In 1999, the European Council established a committee to draft a European Charter of Fundamental Rights, which could serve as the basis for the EU's constitution and apply to EU institutions and bodies. The European Charter of Fundamental Rights included provisions from the European Convention on Human Rights, the European Parliament's 1989 Declaration on Fundamental Rights, and provisions from EU treaties.

Therefore, there were no provisions regarding the protection of basic rights in the original treaties that established the EU.
